definitions: native or citizen of Grenada, an island nation in the Caribbean Sea
examples: The Grenadian explained her country's unique spice heritage proudly
Many Grenadians work in the tourism and agriculture sectors

definitions: neutral achromatic color between black and white on the spectrum
alternative spelling of gray commonly used in British English
examples: The grey clouds gathered ominously before the storm
She painted the walls a soft grey for elegance
British authors typically spell the color as grey
The grey spelling appears throughout Commonwealth literature

definitions: surname of Jacob and Wilhelm Grimm, German scholars who collected and published folk tales
examples: The Brothers Grimm collected hundreds of traditional German stories
Grimm's Fairy Tales includes Cinderella and Snow White

definitions: stage name of Julius Henry Marx, famous American comedian and member of the Marx Brothers
examples: Groucho Marx was known for his quick wit and cigar
The famous Groucho glasses feature bushy eyebrows and mustache

definitions: largest island in the Solomon Islands chain, site of major World War II battle
examples: The Battle of Guadalcanal marked a turning point in the Pacific
Marines landed on Guadalcanal in August nineteen forty-two

definitions: United States territory in Micronesia, largest island in the Mariana Islands
examples: Guam serves as a strategic military base for America
Tourism to Guam contributes significantly to its economy

definitions: major port city in southern China, capital of Guangdong Province, formerly known as Canton
examples: Guangzhou hosts the famous Canton Fair twice yearly
The Pearl River flows through downtown Guangzhou magnificently

definitions: bay on the southeastern coast of Cuba
United States naval base and detention facility located at Guantanamo Bay Cuba
examples: Guantanamo Bay divides Cuba from the Caribbean Sea naturally
The geography of Guantanamo includes mountains and coastline
The Guantanamo detention center has operated since two thousand two
Naval Station Guantanamo Bay spans forty-five square miles

definitions: country in Central America bordered by Mexico, Belize, Honduras and El Salvador
examples: Guatemala contains numerous ancient Maya archaeological sites impressively
Coffee from Guatemala ranks among the world's finest varieties

definitions: native or citizen of Guatemala, a Central American country
examples: The Guatemalan weaver demonstrated traditional textile techniques expertly
Many Guatemalans speak indigenous languages alongside Spanish

definitions: person who is invited to visit or stay temporarily
person who pays to stay at a hotel or lodging
person appearing on a show or program by invitation
examples: The dinner guest arrived precisely at seven o'clock
Wedding guests filled the reception hall with laughter
Hotel guests can access the fitness center anytime
The guest checked out after a three-night stay
Tonight's guest speaker will discuss climate change solutions
The talk show guest promoted her new bestselling book

definitions: surname of Ernesto Che Guevara, Argentine Marxist revolutionary and guerrilla leader
examples: Che Guevara became an icon of revolutionary movements worldwide
Guevara's image appears on countless posters and t-shirts

definitions: name of art museums and foundation established by the Guggenheim family for modern art
examples: The Guggenheim Museum in Bilbao transformed the city dramatically
Frank Lloyd Wright designed the iconic Guggenheim building

definitions: country in West Africa on the Atlantic coast
former British gold coin worth twenty-one shillings used until eighteen sixteen
examples: Guinea exports bauxite and gold to international markets
The capital of Guinea is Conakry on the coast
Auctions were traditionally priced in guineas rather than pounds
A guinea was worth slightly more than a pound

definitions: native or citizen of Guinea, a West African country
examples: The Guinean diplomat addressed the United Nations assembly
Many Guineans speak French as an official language

definitions: legendary queen consort of King Arthur in Arthurian romance and literature
examples: Queen Guinevere's love affair with Lancelot caused tragedy
Guinevere appears in countless Arthurian legends and adaptations

definitions: state in western India on the Arabian Sea known for commerce and industry
examples: Gujarat produces much of India's cotton and textiles
The coastline of Gujarat stretches over sixteen hundred kilometers

definitions: Indo-Aryan language spoken primarily in Gujarat state India
native or resident of Gujarat state in western India
examples: Gujarati script derives from the Devanagari writing system
Over sixty million people speak Gujarati worldwide today
The Gujarati merchant community has spread globally through trade
Many Gujaratis have established successful businesses abroad

definitions: protagonist of Jonathan Swift's satirical novel Gulliver's Travels who visits strange lands
examples: Gulliver encountered tiny Lilliputians and giant Brobdingnagians alike
Swift's Gulliver serves as a satirical commentary on society

definitions: soldier from Nepal serving in British or Indian armies known for bravery and skill
examples: Gurkha regiments have served Britain for over two centuries
The famous Gurkha kukri knife symbolizes their warrior tradition

definitions: Hindu or Sikh spiritual teacher who guides disciples in religious matters
person with extensive knowledge or expertise who guides others in a field
examples: The guru taught meditation techniques to devoted followers daily
Many seek gurus for spiritual enlightenment and guidance
She became the marketing guru for several Fortune 500 companies
The tech guru solved our complex networking problems easily

definitions: Johannes Gutenberg, German inventor who introduced movable type printing to Europe around fourteen fifty
examples: Gutenberg revolutionized knowledge dissemination through his printing press
The Gutenberg Bible was the first major book printed mechanically

definitions: informal word for a man or person in general usage
rope or cable used to secure or guide something
examples: That guy over there knows the answer to your question
The guys are meeting for basketball this evening
The tent guy snapped during the violent windstorm yesterday
Workers secured the antenna mast with several steel guys

definitions: country on the northern coast of South America, formerly British Guiana
examples: Guyana contains vast rainforests and diverse wildlife populations
English is the official language of Guyana uniquely

definitions: native or citizen of Guyana, a South American country
examples: The Guyanese author won international acclaim for her novel
Many Guyanese celebrate both Hindu and Christian holidays

definitions: large room or building equipped for physical exercise and sports activities
type of secondary school in Germany and other European countries preparing students for university
examples: The gymnasium offers basketball courts and fitness equipment
Students practiced volleyball in the school gymnasium daily
She attended gymnasium before entering university in Berlin
The gymnasium curriculum emphasizes classical education and languages

definitions: member of the Roma people, an ethnic group originating from northern India
person who travels from place to place without permanent home
examples: The Gypsy community maintains rich musical and cultural traditions
Roma and Gypsy populations face discrimination across Europe
She lived a gypsy lifestyle traveling in her van
The band adopted a gypsy aesthetic for their tour

definitions: hazardous materials that pose risks to health, safety, or property during transport
examples: The hazmat team responded to the chemical spill immediately
Drivers need special certification to transport hazmat cargo

definitions: high-density lipoprotein, type of cholesterol that removes other cholesterol from arteries
examples: Exercise helps increase HDL levels in your bloodstream naturally
Doctors monitor both HDL and LDL cholesterol during checkups

definitions: high-definition television providing significantly higher resolution than standard television formats
examples: The HDTV displays images in stunning clarity and detail
Most broadcasts now transmit in HDTV format standardly

definitions: human immunodeficiency virus that attacks the immune system and can lead to AIDS
examples: HIV testing should be part of routine healthcare screening
Modern HIV treatments allow patients to live normal lifespans

definitions: health maintenance organization providing managed healthcare services through a network of providers
examples: The HMO requires referrals to see specialist doctors
Many employers offer HMO plans as affordable healthcare options

definitions: hormone replacement therapy used to treat symptoms of menopause by replacing hormones
examples: Her doctor recommended HRT to manage menopausal symptoms effectively
HRT can help prevent osteoporosis in postmenopausal women

definitions: hypertext markup language used to create and structure content on web pages
examples: The website developer wrote clean HTML code for accessibility
HTML tags define the structure and layout of webpages

definitions: hypertext transfer protocol that defines how messages are formatted and transmitted on the web
examples: The HTTP protocol enables communication between browsers and servers
Websites are switching from HTTP to secure HTTPS connections

definitions: transparent display presenting information without requiring users to look away
United States Department of Housing and Urban Development
examples: The fighter jet's HUD shows critical flight information clearly
Modern cars feature HUD technology for navigation displays
HUD provides housing assistance to low-income families nationwide
The HUD secretary announced new affordable housing initiatives

definitions: low continuous vibrating sound made by machines or voices
state of busy activity or energetic movement
examples: The refrigerator's hum kept her awake throughout the night
A gentle hum emanated from the meditation group
The office maintains a productive hum during business hours
The marketplace had a constant hum of commercial activity

definitions: major European royal house that ruled numerous territories from the thirteenth to twentieth centuries
examples: The Habsburg Empire controlled much of Central Europe historically
Habsburg monarchs ruled Spain and Austria for centuries

definitions: record of the sayings, actions, and approvals of Prophet Muhammad in Islamic tradition
examples: Islamic scholars study hadith to understand religious practices properly
The hadith provides guidance beyond what the Quran contains

definitions: Roman Emperor who ruled from 117 to 138 CE and built Hadrian's Wall
examples: Emperor Hadrian built the famous wall across northern Britain
Hadrian traveled extensively throughout the Roman Empire during reign

definitions: major port city in northern Israel on the Mediterranean coast
examples: Haifa serves as Israel's primary seaport for commerce
The Bahai World Centre is located in Haifa

definitions: Caribbean country occupying the western third of the island of Hispaniola
examples: Haiti was the first independent black republic in history
The earthquake devastated Haiti's infrastructure in twenty ten

definitions: native or citizen of Haiti, a Caribbean island nation
examples: The Haitian artist exhibited vibrant paintings internationally
Many Haitians speak both French and Haitian Creole

definitions: period of time that was idyllically happy and peaceful
mythical bird said to breed in floating nest at sea during winter
examples: She remembered the halcyon days of her childhood fondly
The company enjoyed halcyon years before the recession
Ancient Greeks believed the halcyon calmed winter seas
The halcyon nested on the waves according to legend

definitions: capital city of Nova Scotia, Canada, major Atlantic port
large town in West Yorkshire, England
examples: Halifax serves as Atlantic Canada's economic center prominently
The Halifax explosion of 1917 devastated the harbor
Halifax in Yorkshire was a center of wool production
The Halifax Building Society originated in this English town

definitions: large room used for meetings, events, or performances
corridor or passageway in a building
building used as residence, especially in universities
examples: The wedding reception filled the banquet hall completely
Town hall meetings allow citizens to voice concerns
She walked down the hall to her office quietly
The hall connects all the bedrooms upstairs
Students lived in the residence hall during freshman year
The dining hall serves three meals daily

definitions: famous comet visible from Earth every seventy-five to seventy-six years named after Edmund Halley
examples: Halley's Comet last appeared in nineteen eighty-six visibly
Edmund Halley first calculated the comet's orbital period

definitions: annual celebration on October thirty-first featuring costumes, trick-or-treating, and spooky decorations
examples: Children dressed as superheroes for Halloween trick-or-treating festivities
Halloween decorations transformed the neighborhood into spooky wonderland

definitions: meat from the upper part of a pig's leg, preserved by curing, smoking or salting
amateur radio operator who uses radio frequencies for non-commercial exchange
actor who overacts or exaggerates their performance
examples: The honey-glazed ham was the centerpiece of Easter dinner
She ordered a ham and cheese sandwich for lunch
The ham radio operator contacted stations worldwide regularly
During emergencies, ham operators provide crucial communication services
The actor's ham performance drew unintended laughter from audiences
Critics called him a ham for his overly dramatic style

definitions: major port city in northern Germany on the Elbe River, second-largest city in Germany
examples: Hamburg operates one of Europe's busiest container ports
The Beatles performed in Hamburg clubs before becoming famous
